entries: You learn the {@spell find familiar|Ishiir} spell and can cast it as a ritual. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.

When you cast the spell, you can choose one of the normal forms for your familiar or one of the following special forms: {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, {@creature quasit}, or {@creature sprite}.

Additionally, your familiar can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the {@action Dodge|Ishiir} action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}, the familiar can take any action of its choice, not just {@action Dodge|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Star Chain
entries: At 3rd level, a character dedicated to the {@class Warlock|Ishiir|Seeker|Seeker|Ishiir} can select this option instead of one of the warlock's existing Pact Boon options.

The Seeker grants you a chain forged from starlight, decorated with seven gleaming motes of brightness. While the chain is on your person, you know the {@spell augury|Ishiir} spell and can cast it as a ritual. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells known.

Additionally, you can invoke the Seeker's power to gain advantage on an Intelligence check while you carry this item. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

If you lose your Star Chain, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from the Seeker. The ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous chain. The chain disappears in a flash of light when you die.
The exact form of this item might be different depending on your patron. The Star Chain is inspired by the Greyhawk deity Celestian.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Talisman
entries: Your patron gives you an amulet, a talisman that can aid the wearer when the need is great. When the wearer fails an ability check, they can add a {@dice d4} to the roll, potentially turning the roll into a success. This benefit can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expended uses are restored when you finish a long rest.

If you lose the talisman, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous amulet. The talisman turns to ash when you die.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Tome
entries: Your patron gives you a grimoire called a Book of Shadows. When you gain this feature, choose three {@filter cantrips|spells|level=0|source=Ishiir} from any class's spell list. The cantrips do not need to be from the same spell list. While the book is on your person, you can cast those cantrips at will. They don't count against your number of cantrips known. Any cantrip you cast with this feature is considered a warlock cantrip for you. If you lose your Book of Shadows, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous book. The book turns to ash when you die.

optionalfeature.name: Cloud Rune
entries: This rune emulates the deceptive magic used by some cloud giants. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) checks and Charisma ({@skill Deception}) checks.

In addition, when you or a creature you can see within 30 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to invoke the rune and choose a different creature within 30 feet of you, other than the attacker. The chosen creature becomes the target of the attack, using the same roll. This magic can transfer the attack's effects regardless of the attack's range. Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Fire Rune
entries: This rune's magic channels the masterful craftsmanship of great smiths. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses your proficiency with a tool.

In addition, when you hit a creature with an attack using a weapon, you can invoke the rune to summon fiery shackles: the target takes an extra {@damage 2d6} fire damage, and it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained|Ishiir} for 1 minute. While {@condition restrained|Ishiir} by the shackles, the target takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, banishing the shackles on a success. Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Frost Rune
entries: This rune's magic evokes the might of those who survive in the wintry wilderness, such as frost giants. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks and Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks.

In addition, you can invoke the rune as a bonus action to increase your sturdiness. For 10 minutes, you gain a +2 bonus to all ability checks and saving throws that use Strength or Constitution. Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Hill Rune
entries: This rune's magic bestows a resilience reminiscent of a hill giant. While wearing or carrying an object that bears this rune, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned|Ishiir}, and you have resistance against poison damage.

In addition, you can invoke the rune as a bonus action, gaining resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute. Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Stone Rune
entries: This rune's magic channels the judiciousness associated with stone giants. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks, and you have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 120 feet.

In addition, when a creature you can see ends its turn within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to invoke the rune and force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. Unless the save succeeds, the creature is {@condition charmed|Ishiir} by you for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed|Ishiir} in this way, the creature has a speed of 0 and is {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}, descending into a dreamy stupor. The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Storm Rune
entries: Using this rune, you can glimpse the future like a storm giant seer. While wearing or carrying an object inscribed with this rune, you have advantage on Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) checks, and you can't be {@quickref Surprise|PHB|3|0|surprised} as long as you aren't {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}.

In addition, you can invoke the rune as a bonus action to enter a prophetic state for 1 minute or until you're {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}. Until the state ends, when you or another creature you can see within 60 feet of you makes an attack roll, a saving throw, or an ability check, you can use your reaction to cause the roll to have advantage or disadvantage. Once you invoke this rune, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Aquatic Traits
entries: Increase one ability score of your Eidolon from among Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by 1.
Your Eidolon gains a swimming speed if it doesn't already have one, equal to its highest speed and it can breathe underwater.

optionalfeature.name: Breath Weapon
entries: Your Eidolon learns to exhale destructive energy. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, radiant, or thunder.
Additionally, choose the area shape that the Breath Weapon affects: 15 + 5 x proficiency feet cone or 30 + 10 x proficiency feet long, 5 feet wide line.

Your Eidolon can activate its Breath Weapon as an action. Each creature in the area of effect has to make a DEX saving throw against your spell save DC, taking 4d6 + 1d6 x proficiency of the chosen damage type on a failure and half as much on a success.
Once it has used its breath weapon it cannot do so again until you finish a short rest or you spend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher.

optionalfeature.name: Chamaeleon Hide
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Dexterity or Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
Your Eidolon can use its bonus action to become {@condition invisible|Ishiir}. The invisibility ends if your Eidolon performs a hostile action.

optionalfeature.name: Damage Immunity
entries: When you are in Symbiosis with your Eidolon, you are immune to every damage type you selected for Damage Resistance evolution feat.

optionalfeature.name: Damage Resistance
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
Your Eidolon gains resistance to one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, or radiant.
This evolution feat can be selected multiple times.

optionalfeature.name: Eidolon Resilience
entries: Choose one ability score. Your Eidolon gains the following benefits:

items: Increase the chosen ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Your Eidolon gains proficiency in saving throws using the chosen ability.

entries: This evolution feat can be selected multiple times.

optionalfeature.name: Eidolon Toughness
entries: Your Eidolon's hitpoints increase by an amount equal to twice your summoner level.
This evolution feat can be selected multiple times.

optionalfeature.name: Energy Infusion
entries: Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, radiant, or thunder.
Your Eidolon's weapon attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d6} of the chosen damage type.

optionalfeature.name: Enhanced Physiology
entries: Increase one ability score of your Eidolon from among Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by 2 or increase 2 ability scores from among those by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
This evolution feat can be selected multiple times.

optionalfeature.name: Evasion
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Dexterity by 1, to a maximum of 20.

If the Eidolon is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

optionalfeature.name: Fear Aura
entries: Any creature hostile to Eidolon that starts its turn within 20 feet of it or enters that area for the first time on a turn, must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC, unless the Eidolon is {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened|Ishiir} until the start of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the Eidolon's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Fierce Charge
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Once your turn, when your Eidolon moves towards a creature in a straight line for the first time, it can add 1 dmg for every 5 ft spent as part of that movement to the first melee weapon damage roll it makes against that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Grappling Attacks
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength or Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Creatures no more than one size larger than your Eidolon that are hit by your Eidolon's natural weapon attacks have to make a STR or DEX saving throw (target creature's choice) against your spell save DC. On failure, the target creature is {@condition grappled|Ishiir} by your Eidolon. Creatures that are the same size of the Eidolon or smaller, are also {@condition restrained|Ishiir} while grappled in this manner.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Size Increase
entries: Your Eidolon's size increases to huge and its hitpoints increase by an amount equal to your summoner level.
Additionally, the reach of its melee weapon attacks increases by 5 feet and the die size for its natural weapons and damaging abilities increases by 1 step.

optionalfeature.name: Hardened Hide
entries: Your Eidolon's AC increases by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Skill
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
Your Eidolon learns one additional skill. If it is already proficient in the skill, it adds double your proficiency bonus to checks it makes with it.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Speed
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
Your Eidolon's speed increases by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Intertwined Metabolism
entries: When you are in Symbiosis with your Eidolon, you are immune to the {@condition poisoned|Ishiir} and {@condition lacerated|Ishiir} conditions and to non-magical diseases. If you enter Symbiosis while any of the aforementioned are already affecting either you or your Eidolon or both, they are removed at the end of the same turn.

optionalfeature.name: Lacerating Attacks
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength or Dexterity by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Creatures hit by your Eidolon's natural weapon attacks have to make a CON saving throw against your spell save DC. On failure, the target creature is {@condition lacerated|Ishiir}. At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the condition on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Resistance
entries: When your Eidolon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.
Your Eidolon can use this feature three times and it regains all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Eidolon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

optionalfeature.name: Pack Leader
entries: Creatures summoned by you have advantage on attack rolls against any creatures that they can see within 5 feet of your Eidolon, unless your Eidolon is {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: As an action, your Eidolon can gaze at a creature within 60 feet of it, causing it to gradually turn to stone. The target creature has to make a CON saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, it is {@condition restrained|Ishiir} as its flesh begins to harden. On a successful save, the creature isn't affected.

A creature restrained by this ability must make another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this ability three times, the effect ends. If it fails its saves three times, it is turned to stone and subjected to the {@condition petrified|Ishiir} condition for the duration. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind.
If the creature is physically broken while petrified, it suffers from similar deformities if it reverts to its original state.
Once it has used its petrifying gaze it cannot do so again until you finish a short rest or you spend a spell slot of 5th level or higher.

optionalfeature.name: Pounce
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength or Dexterity by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
Once per turn, as part of a melee weapon attack, your Eidolon can move up to its speed in a straight line towards a target of your choice.

optionalfeature.name: Ranged Attacks
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength or Dexterity by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Your Eidolon gains a ranged natural weapon attack with a range of 80/320. The damage die of this attack is identical to its other natural attacks and uses the same ability score for attack and damage rolls.
You can choose the damage type of the ranged attack from one of the following: acid, bludgeoning, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, piercing, poison, radiant, slashing, or thunder.

optionalfeature.name: Regeneration
entries: Your Eidolon regenerates an amount of hitpoints equal to twice your proficiency at the start of each of its turns.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: Your Eidolon gains proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill. If it is already proficient in the skill, it adds double your proficiency bonus to checks it makes with it.
While in dim light or darkness, your Eidolon can take the {@action Hide|Ishiir} action as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Size Increase
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength or Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
Your Eidolon's size increases to large and its hitpoints increase by an amount equal to your summoner level.

optionalfeature.name: Shimmering Hide
entries: Your Eidolon projects a magical illusion that blurs its appearance to the naked eye and makes it difficult to tell its actual position and movements, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it takes damage, this trait is disrupted until the start of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the Eidolon is {@condition incapacitated|Ishiir} or has a speed of 0.

optionalfeature.name: Special Senses
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
Your Eidolon gains one of the following senses of your choice:

items: {@sense Blindsight|PHB} within 30 feet.
{@sense Tremorsense|MM} within 60 feet.
{@optfeature Devil's Sight|Ishiir} within 120 feet.

entries: This evolution feat can be selected multiple times.

optionalfeature.name: Subterranean Traits
entries: Increase one ability score of your Eidolon from among Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution by 1.
Your Eidolon gains a climbing speed equal to its walking speed and a burrowing speed equal to half its walking speed.
Additionally, the {@sense darkvision|PHB} range of your Eidolon increases to 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Unshakeable Devotion
entries: Your Eidolon is immune to the {@condition Charmed|Ishiir} and {@condition Frightened|Ishiir} conditions.

optionalfeature.name: Toppling Attacks
entries: Increase your Eidolon's Strength or Constitution by 1, up to a maximum of 20.

Creatures no more than one size larger than your Eidolon that are hit by your Eidolon's natural weapon attacks have to make a STR saving throw against your spell save DC. On failure, the target creature is knocked {@condition prone|Ishiir}.

optionalfeature.name: Vanguard
entries: Whenever you a creature summoned by you that is within 20 feet of your Eidolon must make a saving throw, the creature gains a bonus to the saving throw equal to your Charisma modifier (with a minimum bonus of +1).

optionalfeature.name: Venomous Attacks
entries: Creatures hit by your Eidolon's natural weapon attacks have to make a CON saving throw against your spell save DC. On failure, the target creature is {@condition poisoned|Ishiir}. A poisoned creature takes poison damage equal to twice your proficiency at the start of each of its turns.
At the end of each of its turns, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the condition on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Wings
entries: Your Eidolon gains a flying speed if it doesn't already have one, equal to its highest speed.

optionalfeature.name: Cleave
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can also deal damage equal to your STR or DEX (your choice) to any other creature that is within range of your attack and within 5 ft of the original target, provided that your attack roll would've also hit these targets. This damage is doubled if the attack roll was a critical hit.
If the attack reduced the original target to 0 hitpoints, you instead deal your full weapon damage to one of the additional targets.

optionalfeature.name: Flurry
entries: When you use two-weapon fighting and both of your weapons have this mastery, you can make the extra attack of your off-hand weapon as part of the {@action Attack|Ishiir} action rather than as a bonus action. If you do so, you can't use any other mastery with the attacks that are part of this {@action Attack|Ishiir} action.

optionalfeature.name: Gash
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force it to make a CON saving throw or take damage equal to your proficiency at the start of its next turn for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Lunge
entries: When you attack with this weapon, you can increase its range by 5 feet. You can also use this mastery to increase the reach of your weapon for the purposes of satisfying trigger conditions of melee attacks you can make as a reaction, e.g. opportunity attacks or the Battle Master's brace maneuver.

optionalfeature.name: Pierce
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can roll a {@dice d4} and it add it to the next weapon attack you make against it before the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Push
entries: When you hit a creature that is no more than 1 size category larger than you with this weapon, you can force it to make a STR saving throw or move it 5 ft in a direction you choose.

optionalfeature.name: Sap
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force it to make a CON saving throw. On a failure, it must roll a {@dice d4} when it next makes an attack roll or saving throw (your choice) and subtract the result from the total.

optionalfeature.name: Slow
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force it to make a CON saving throw or halve its speed until beginning of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Light
entries: While wearing this armor, you have a number of temporary hitpoints equal to its AC, which stack with any other form of temporary hitpoints. You regain any lost temporary hitpoints from this feature when you finish a short or long rest by expending 1 sp per temporary hitpoint.

optionalfeature.name: Medium
entries: While wearing this armor, you have a number of temporary hitpoints equal to its AC, which stack with any other form of temporary hitpoints. You regain any lost temporary hitpoints from this feature when you finish a short or long rest by expending 5 sp per temporary hitpoint.

optionalfeature.name: Heavy
entries: While wearing this armor, you have a number of temporary hitpoints equal to 1.5 times its AC (rounded down), which stack with any other form of temporary hitpoints. You regain any lost temporary hitpoints from this feature when you finish a short or long rest by expending 1 gp per temporary hitpoint.

optionalfeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While using your Unarmored Defense or similar permanent feature that alters the calculation for your AC, you have a number of temporary hitpoints equal to its AC, which stack with any other form of temporary hitpoints. You can regain any lost temporary hitpoints from this feature when you finish a short or long rest by expending 5 sp per temporary hitpoint.
